name: Bench Press
description: The bench press is a compound exercise that targets the muscles of the upper body. It involves lying on a weight bench and pressing weight upward using either a barbell or dumbbells.
instructions: Lie on your back on a flat bench with your feet flat on the ground.
Grip the barbell with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Lift the bar off the rack and hold it straight over your chest with arms locked.
Lower the bar slowly until it touches your mid-chest.
Push the bar back to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

name: Squat
description: The squat is a compound exercise that trains primarily the muscles of the thighs, hips, and buttocks, as well as strengthening the bones, ligaments, and tendons throughout the lower body.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly turned out.
Position the barbell on your upper back, resting on your trapezius muscles.
Maintain a neutral spine and brace your core.
Bend at the knees and hips to lower your body, keeping your chest up.
Lower until your thighs are at least parallel to the ground.
Push through your heels to return to the starting position.

name: Deadlift
description: The deadlift is a weight training exercise in which a loaded barbell is lifted off the ground to the level of the hips, then lowered back to the ground. It is one of the three powerlifting exercises, along with the squat and bench press.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, with the barbell over your mid-foot.
Bend at the hips and knees to grip the bar with hands shoulder-width apart.
Lower your hips and lift your chest to create a flat back.
Take a deep breath, brace your core, and drive through your heels.
Keep the bar close to your body as you stand up straight.
Once upright, push your hips forward to lock out.
Lower the bar by hinging at the hips and bending the knees.

name: Pull-Up
description: The pull-up is a closed-chain exercise where the body is suspended by the hands and pulled up. As a compound exercise, it works many muscles of the upper body including the latissimus dorsi and biceps.
instructions: Grip the pull-up bar with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width apart, palms facing away.
Hang with arms fully extended, engaging your shoulder blades.
Pull your body up by driving your elbows down and back.
Continue pulling until your chin clears the bar.
Lower your body with control until arms are fully extended.

name: Overhead Press
description: The overhead press is a compound weight training exercise in which a weight is pressed upwards from the shoulders until the arms are extended overhead. It is a test of shoulder and upper body strength.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding a barbell at shoulder height.
Grip the bar with hands just outside shoulder width, elbows pointing down.
Brace your core and squeeze your glutes.
Press the bar overhead until your arms are fully extended.
Lower the bar with control back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Bicep Curl
description: The dumbbell bicep curl is an isolation exercise that targets the biceps brachii muscle. It is a highly effective exercise for developing the front of the upper arm.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding dumbbells at your sides, palms facing forward.
Keep your upper arms stationary and elbows close to your torso.
Curl the weights upward while contracting your biceps.
Continue until the dumbbells are at shoulder level, with only your forearms moving.
Hold the contracted position for a brief pause.
Slowly lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Plank
description: The plank is an isometric core strength exercise that involves maintaining a position similar to a push-up for the maximum possible time. It strengthens the abdominals, back, and shoulders.
instructions: Start in a push-up position, then bend your elbows 90 degrees and rest your weight on your forearms.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to feet, ensuring your hips don't sag.
Engage your core by pulling your belly button toward your spine.
Hold the position for the desired amount of time, breathing steadily.
To release, gently lower your knees to the ground.

name: Lat Pulldown
description: The lat pulldown is a compound exercise that targets the latissimus dorsi muscle of the back. It is a good alternative to pull-ups for those who cannot yet perform them.
instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown machine with your thighs secured under the pads.
Grasp the bar with a wide overhand grip, arms fully extended.
Pull the bar down to your upper chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together.
Hold the contracted position briefly.
Slowly return the bar to the starting position, fully extending your arms.

name: Leg Press
description: The leg press is a compound weight training exercise in which the individual pushes a weight away from them using their legs. It primarily targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes.
instructions: Sit on the leg press machine with your back against the padded support.
Place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform.
Release the safety bars and lower the platform until your knees form 90-degree angles.
Push through your heels to extend your legs without locking your knees.
Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Running (Treadmill)
description: Treadmill running is a cardiovascular exercise that improves heart health, burns calories, and builds endurance. It's a controlled environment for running that reduces impact on joints compared to outdoor running.
instructions: Start with a 5-minute warm-up at a comfortable walking pace.
Gradually increase the speed to a jogging or running pace.
Maintain good posture with your head up, shoulders relaxed, and core engaged.
Swing your arms naturally at your sides.
Land midfoot and roll through to the toe, avoiding heel striking.
Cool down with 5 minutes of walking at the end of your session.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: The dumbbell shoulder press is a compound exercise that targets the deltoid muscles. Using dumbbells allows for a greater range of motion and requires more stabilization than a barbell.
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand.
Position the dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing forward.
Keep your chest up and core engaged.
Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended overhead.
Slowly lower the weights back to shoulder level.

name: Romanian Deadlift
description: The Romanian deadlift is a variation of the deadlift that emphasizes the hamstrings and glutes. It's excellent for developing posterior chain strength and improving hip mobility.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, holding a barbell in front of your thighs.
Keep a slight bend in your knees throughout the movement.
Hinge at the hips and push your buttocks backward as you lower the bar.
Keep your back straight and the bar close to your legs.
Lower until you feel a stretch in your hamstrings, typically just below the knees.
Drive your hips forward to return to the starting position.

name: Tricep Dips
description: Tricep dips are a bodyweight exercise that primarily targets the triceps, with secondary engagement of the chest and shoulders. They can be performed on parallel bars, a bench, or specialized dip stations.
instructions: Grip the parallel bars and push yourself up to the starting position with arms fully extended.
Keep your elbows tucked in close to your body.
Lower your body by bending your elbows until they reach a 90-degree angle.
Pause briefly at the bottom of the movement.
Push yourself back up to the starting position, focusing on using your triceps.

name: Cable Row
description: The cable row is a compound pulling exercise that targets the muscles of the back, particularly the lats and rhomboids. It also engages the biceps and rear delts as secondary muscles.
instructions: Sit at a cable row station with feet braced against the platform and knees slightly bent.
Grasp the handle with both hands, arms extended and back straight.
Pull the handle toward your lower abdomen, keeping your back straight and elbows close to your body.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position.

name: Crunches
description: Crunches are a classic abdominal exercise that targets the rectus abdominis muscles. They involve lifting the shoulders off the ground in a controlled manner to engage the core.
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart.
Place your hands behind your head, elbows pointing outward.
Engage your core muscles and lift your shoulders off the floor, keeping your lower back pressed into the ground.
Exhale as you curl up, focusing on contracting your abdominals.
Lower back down with control, without letting your head touch the floor.

name: Cycling (Stationary Bike)
description: Stationary biking is a low-impact cardiovascular exercise that primarily targets the lower body muscles while improving heart health and endurance.
instructions: Adjust the seat height so that your knee is slightly bent at the bottom of the pedal stroke.
Sit on the bike with a slight forward lean from the hips.
Begin pedaling at a moderate resistance level for a 5-minute warm-up.
Increase resistance to reach your target intensity.
Maintain a steady cadence, typically between 60-100 RPM.
Keep your core engaged and shoulders relaxed.
Cool down with 5 minutes of easy pedaling at the end.

name: Push-Ups
description: Push-ups are a classic bodyweight exercise that primarily targets the chest, shoulders, and triceps. They also engage the core and are excellent for building upper body strength.
instructions: Start in a plank position with hands placed slightly wider than shoulder-width apart.
Keep your body in a straight line from head to heels.
Lower your body until your chest nearly touches the floor, keeping elbows at about a 45-degree angle from your body.
Push yourself back up to the starting position, fully extending your arms.
Keep your core engaged throughout the movement.

name: Dumbbell Lunges
description: Dumbbell lunges are a unilateral lower body exercise that targets the quadriceps, hamstrings, and glutes. They also improve balance and core stability.
instructions: Stand upright holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides.
Take a large step forward with one leg.
Lower your body until both knees are bent at approximately 90 degrees.
Keep your front knee aligned with your ankle, not pushed forward past your toes.
Push through the heel of your front foot to return to the starting position.
Repeat with the opposite leg.

name: Face Pull
description: The face pull is an isolation exercise that targets the posterior deltoids, middle trapezius, and external rotators of the shoulder. It is excellent for improving shoulder health and posture.
instructions: Set a cable pulley to slightly above head height and attach a rope handle.
Grasp the rope with both hands, palms facing each other.
Step back to create tension in the cable, maintaining a shoulder-width stance.
Pull the rope toward your face, separating your hands as you pull.
Focus on pulling with your rear shoulders, bringing the ends of the rope alongside your ears.
Squeeze your shoulder blades together at the end of the movement.
Slowly return to the starting position with controlled movement.

name: Calf Raises
description: Calf raises are an isolation exercise that targets the gastrocnemius and soleus muscles. They are effective for building lower leg strength and improving ankle stability.
instructions: Stand with the balls of your feet on a raised surface such as a step or platform.
Let your heels hang off the edge.
Keep your core engaged and back straight.
Push through the balls of your feet to raise your heels as high as possible.
Hold the contracted position briefly at the top.
Lower your heels below the level of the platform for a full stretch.
